title: AIMIM plans to field 2020 Delhi riots accused Shahrukh Pathan, who pointed gun at cops, in assembly polls - Hindustan Times
summary:
AIMIM Considers Shahrukh Pathan for Delhi Assembly Elections

Publication Date: Dec 25, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) is contemplating the candidacy of Shahrukh Pathan, an accused from the 2020 Delhi riots, for the upcoming assembly elections.

  • Shahrukh Pathan has been in Tihar jail since March 2020 for his role in the riots.
  • His candidacy is not yet finalized, according to AIMIM sources.
  • AIMIM's Delhi unit intends to contest 12 assembly seats.
  • The assembly elections are scheduled for February next year, amidst a competitive political landscape in Delhi.
“Pathan’s name is being considered for candidacy, but no official decision has been made.” - Shoaib Jamei, AIMIM’s Delhi unit president

The potential nomination of Shahrukh Pathan highlights AIMIM's strategy in the forthcoming elections and raises significant questions about candidate selection amid ongoing legal challenges.
newTitle: AIMIM Considers Shahrukh Pathan for Delhi Assembly Elections

title: Bangladesh drops another shocker, threatens action against India if Modi govt refuses to... - India.com
summary:
Bangladesh Threatens Action Against India Over Sheikh Hasina Extradition

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: India.com

Bangladesh has announced that it is waiting for a response from India regarding the extradition of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina. The foreign ministry has issued a formal request and stated that they will take further action if India does not reply soon.

  • Bangladesh sent a diplomatic note to India on December 23 but has not yet received a response.
  • A 'note of urgency' will be issued if India fails to respond within a certain period.
  • No specific timeline exists for the extradition process between the two countries.
  • The spokesperson for Bangladesh stressed that the country is willing to wait but will not hesitate to act further.
"If India does not respond on the issue in an appropriate period of time, Bangladesh will take further steps to ensure Hasina’s extradition." - Mohammed Rafiqul Alam

In conclusion, Bangladesh's threats of diplomatic action highlight the tension surrounding the extradition request of Sheikh Hasina and could escalate if responses from India remain pending.
newTitle: Bangladesh Threatens Action Against India Over Sheikh Hasina Extradition

Judicial officer suspended for allegedly outraging modesty of woman court employee - The Hindu
summary:
Judicial officer suspended for allegedly outraging modesty of woman court employee

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: The Hindu

M. Suhaib, an Additional District Judge in Kozhikode, has been suspended following allegations of misconduct involving a woman court employee. This decision was taken after an emergency meeting of the Administrative Committee of the Kerala High Court, led by Chief Justice Nitin Madhukar Jamdar, which deemed the allegations as damaging to the credibility of the judiciary.

  • The incident reportedly took place in the judge's official chamber.
  • The court received an oral apology from the judge towards the woman involved.
  • The woman has been reluctant to file a formal complaint, complicating potential legal actions.
  • The judicial officer will be issued a show cause notice regarding his conduct.
  • This case has raised concerns among the legal community regarding the judiciary's integrity.
“The alleged incident has dented the credibility of the judicial institution of the State.”

This incident highlights ongoing challenges within institutional frameworks regarding accountability and the handling of misconduct allegations.
newTitle: Judicial Officer Suspended Over Allegations of Misconduct

summary:
Arunish Chawla appointed new revenue secretary; Manipur CS Vineet Joshi to head education secretary

In a recent government reshuffle, Arunish Chawla has been appointed as the new revenue secretary, and Vineet Joshi, the Chief Secretary of Manipur, will now head the education department. This change is aimed at enhancing the efficiency of revenue collection and management within the education sector.

  • Arunish Chawla takes on the role of revenue secretary.
  • Vineet Joshi will serve as the head of the education department.
  • The changes are part of a broader government reorganization.
  • Focus on improving revenue management and educational outcomes.

title: Kerala: Man narrowly escapes as train speeds over him in Kannur - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kerala Man Survives Train Incident in Kannur

Date: Dec 25, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

A viral video captured a man in Kerala's Kannur district narrowly escaping an oncoming train by lying flat on the tracks. Identified as 56-year-old Pavithran, he remained unharmed as the train passed over him.

  • The incident occurred around 5 pm between Kannur and Chirakkal railway stations.
  • Pavithran was talking on his phone and didn't notice the train until it was too late.
  • His quick action to lie down on the tracks saved his life.
  • Rumors spread about him being drunk, which he denied, explaining he did this to survive.
“I still haven’t recovered from the fear,” Pavithran stated.

The incident has drawn widespread attention on social media, and railway police confirmed his account.
newTitle: Kerala Man Survives Train Incident in Kannur

summary:
Tourist boat capsizes off Calangute beach in North Goa; 1 killed

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Times of India

A tragic incident occurred off Calangute beach in North Goa where a tourist boat capsized, resulting in the death of one person.

  • The incident took place during peak tourist season.
  • Rescue operations were initiated promptly by local authorities.
  • Several tourists were onboard, with immediate medical attention provided to survivors.
“This unfortunate event highlights the importance of safety measures for tourist activities,” a local official commented.

The boat capsizing has raised concerns about safety regulations in place for tourist vessels, prompting further investigations.

title: Man sets himself on fire near Parliament building, sustains 90% burn injuries - Hindustan Times
summary:
Man Sets Himself on Fire Near Parliament, Suffers Severe Injuries

Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A man, identified as Jitendra from Uttar Pradesh, attempted self-immolation near the new Parliament building in Delhi, sustaining critical injuries.

  • The incident occurred around 3:30 PM near the Railway Bhawan.
  • Jitendra sustained 90% burn injuries and was taken to Ram Manohar Lohia Hospital.
  • Preliminary investigations suggest his actions may be linked to personal issues.
  • No suicide note was found, and he had previous legal troubles.
“He is around 30-35 years old,” said DCP New Delhi Devesh Mahla.

The incident highlights the ongoing mental health issues and personal struggles faced by individuals.
newTitle: Man Sets Himself on Fire Near Parliament, Suffers Severe Injuries

title: Union Minister demands Bharat Ratna for ex-Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar - OTV News
summary:
Union Minister demands Bharat Ratna for ex-Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar

Date: Not specified, Source: Odishatv.in

Union Minister Giriraj Singh has demanded the Bharat Ratna, India’s highest civilian award, for Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar and former Odisha CM Naveen Patnaik. Singh highlighted their transformative contributions to their respective states.

  • Sinh highlighted improvements in Bihar under Nitish Kumar.
  • He praised Kumar for lifting Bihar from the 'jungle raj' era.
  • Singh commended Naveen Patnaik's dedication and service in Odisha.
  • The demand for Bharat Ratna comes amid political tension related to upcoming Bihar Assembly elections.
  • Both BJP and JDU reaffirmed support for Nitish Kumar’s leadership for the elections.
“The contributions of such leaders should be recognised at the national level with the Bharat Ratna, as their efforts have significantly impacted the lives of millions and set benchmarks in governance,” Singh said.

This call to honour both leaders reflects the ongoing dynamics and the BJP's strategy of unity within the NDA for the 2025 elections.
newTitle: Union Minister Calls for Bharat Ratna for Nitish Kumar and Naveen Patnaik

title: 226 roads closed in Himachal due to snowfall, IMD warns of 'severe cold' till Sunday; J&K faces 'Chillai-Kalan' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Severe Cold and Road Closures in Himachal Due to Snowfall

Publication Date: December 25, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

A severe cold wave in Himachal Pradesh resulted in the closure of 226 roads, including three national highways, following significant snowfall. The IMD warns of further cold conditions through Sunday.

  • 226 roads closed, impacting travel and daily life.
  • Severe cold recorded across various districts, particularly in higher altitudes.
  • The IMD has issued warnings for rain and snow over the weekend.
  • Forecast predicts temperatures to decrease further in both Himachal and Jammu & Kashmir.
  • Water bodies and supply lines are freezing in Kashmir, complicating conditions.
“The weather office has issued an 'orange' warning for severe cold in Bilaspur, Una, Hamirpur, and Mandi.”

In conclusion, the severe weather conditions have significantly impacted travel and daily activities, particularly in Himachal Pradesh and Jammu & Kashmir. Residents should stay informed about the ongoing weather alerts.
newTitle: Severe Cold and Road Closures in Himachal Due to Snowfall

A man reportedly set himself on fire near the Parliament in Delhi, leading to a swift response from emergency services.

At least 4 dead, many injured after bus falls into gorge in Nainital

title: Sriram Krishnan's inclusion as a policy adviser for Donald Trump sparks anti-India hate on US social media - OpIndia
summary:
Sriram Krishnan's New Role in Trump's Cabinet Ignites Controversy

Publication Date: December 23, 2024 | Source: OpIndia

Sriram Krishnan has been appointed as a Senior Policy Advisor for Artificial Intelligence by President-elect Donald Trump, stirring backlash on social media, especially from conservative circles.

  • Krishnan, a technology veteran who has worked at prominent companies, is tasked with shaping AI policy at the White House.
  • His stance on immigration, specifically regarding H1-B visas, sparked controversy and accusations of undermining Trump's America First policy.
  • Public criticism was largely driven by right-wing commentators who misrepresented his views on immigration.
  • Supporters of Krishnan clarified that his proposals aim for a merit-based immigration system.
  • Some individuals claim Krishnan prioritizes foreign workers over American citizens in technology sectors.
“I’m honoured to be able to serve our country and ensure continued American leadership in AI working closely with David Sacks. Thank you, Donald Trump, for this opportunity.” — Sriram Krishnan

The uproar reflects broader tensions surrounding immigration and the role of minorities in American politics, specifically targeting Indian-Americans like Krishnan.
newTitle: Sriram Krishnan's New Role in Trump's Cabinet Ignites Controversy

Amid PM Modi outreach to Church, a look at Sangh Parivar’s fraught ties with Christians - The Indian Express
summary:
PM Modi's Outreach to Christian Community Amid Tensions with Sangh Parivar

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Indian Express

Prime Minister Narendra Modi's recent address to the Catholic Bishops’ Conference of India marks a significant outreach towards Christians, coinciding with various tensions between the Sangh Parivar and Christian communities in India.

  • Modi condemned recent attacks on Christians, aligning his message with Christian teachings.
  • The BJP is reportedly aiming to strengthen ties with Christians in response to political stakes in states with Christian populations.
  • Tensions remain due to historical conflicts over conversions and the Sangh Parivar's efforts to counter missionary activities.
  • Former RSS chief's remarks highlight ongoing suspicions towards Christians perceived as foreign agents.
  • The BJP has implemented stricter anti-conversion laws in states under its rule.
“PM Modi had told party leaders during our office-bearers’ meetings to reach out to all communities,” - BJP leader

The Prime Minister's efforts indicate a strategic pivot by the BJP to connect with diverse faith communities while navigating complex historical relationships.
newTitle: PM Modi's Outreach to Christian Community Amid Tensions with Sangh Parivar

title: IMD issues yellow warning for heavy rainfall, dense fog in Odisha districts - OTV News
summary:
IMD Warns Heavy Rainfall & Dense Fog in Odisha

Publication Date: December 26, 2024   Source: OTV News

Several parts of Odisha are experiencing rainfall due to a well-marked low-pressure area in the Bay of Bengal. Heavy rainfall has been reported in Khordha and Kalahandi, with further impacts expected.

  • Heavy rainfall and light to moderate rain have been observed across various districts.
  • Future rain forecasts suggest increased rainfall in coastal and southern interior regions.
  • A yellow warning has been issued for districts likely to experience heavy rainfall.
  • Dense fog is also anticipated in several districts over the next two days.
“Heavy rainfall is very likely to occur at one or two places over several districts including Nabarangpur, Kalahandi, and Khordha.”

Residents are advised to remain cautious due to potential flooding and low visibility on the roads.
newTitle: IMD Warns Heavy Rainfall & Dense Fog in Odisha

PM Modi lays foundation for Ken-Betwa river-linking project to solve water woes of Bundelkhand - The Hindu
summary:
PM Modi Initiates Ken-Betwa River-Linking Project to Alleviate Water Scarcity in Bundelkhand

Published on: December 25, 2024, Source: The Hindu

On December 25, 2024, Prime Minister Narendra Modi laid the foundation for the Ken-Betwa river-linking project in Khajuraho, Madhya Pradesh, intended to resolve the water issues in the drought-prone Bundelkhand region.

  • The project is estimated to cost around ₹45,000 crore.
  • It aims to address drinking and irrigation water needs for over 10 districts in Madhya Pradesh and several in Uttar Pradesh.
  • It is expected to generate over 100 MW of hydropower and 27 MW of solar energy.
  • Mr. Modi highlighted the contribution of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar to water conservation efforts.
  • Concerns have been raised about the project's impact on the biodiversity of the Panna Tiger Reserve.
“The major river valley projects of India were based on the vision of Babasaheb Ambedkar.” - PM Modi

The Ken-Betwa project is seen as a pivotal step towards ensuring sustainable water management in the region, although environmental ramifications remain a point of contention.
newTitle: PM Modi Initiates Ken-Betwa River-Linking Project to Alleviate Water Scarcity in Bundelkhand

title: Modi lays foundation stone of Ken-Betwa river linking project; hails Ambedkar's vision - The Hindu
summary:
PM Modi Launches Ken-Betwa River Linking Project, Highlights Ambedkar's Contribution

Date: December 25, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

Prime Minister Narendra Modi laid the foundation stone for the Ken-Betwa river linking project in Madhya Pradesh, emphasizing the importance of water resource management and criticizing Congress for neglecting Dr. B.R. Ambedkar's contributions.

  • The project aims to provide drinking water to approximately 65 lakh people in Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh.
  • It will benefit nearly 7.18 lakh agricultural families across 2,000 villages.
  • The project will involve a total cost of ₹44,605 crore.
  • PM Modi inaugurated the Omkareshwar Floating Solar Project and laid the foundation for the Daudhan Irrigation Project during the ceremony.
“The major challenge of the 21st century is water security. In the 21st century only those countries who have adequate water resources with proper management will move forward,” said PM Modi.

The Ken-Betwa project is expected to enhance prosperity in the Bundelkhand region while advancing significant developments in water management.
newTitle: PM Modi Launches Ken-Betwa River Linking Project, Highlights Ambedkar's Contribution

What's behind Centre's decision to send ex-home secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla to Manipur as governor - ThePrint
summary:
What's behind Centre's decision to send ex-home secretary Ajay Kumar Bhalla to Manipur as governor

Publication Date: December 24, 2024
Source: ThePrint

Ajay Kumar Bhalla, former Union home secretary, has been appointed as the new governor of Manipur to address the ongoing violence and crisis that has left over 250 dead and more than 50,000 displaced since May 2023.

His extensive crisis management experience is seen as crucial in negotiating peace between the warring Kukis and Meiteis factions in the region.

  • Bhalla has a record of handling major crises including the abrogation of Article 370 and the COVID-19 pandemic.
  • He succeeds Lakshman Prasad Acharya, who previously managed the state's affairs.
  • The appointment comes amid continued unrest and challenges to law and order in Manipur.
  • Bhalla is expected to bring a different approach to managing the state's issues, leveraging his past experiences.
Former Home Secretary Bhalla to be Manipur governor. The one who couldn’t manage it from Delhi is now expected to oversee it. A sign that president’s rule may be soon imposed – after months of chaos. — K. C. Singh

The appointment of Bhalla signals a possible shift in how the Centre aims to manage the ongoing crisis in Manipur, as tensions escalate and the need for political solutions becomes more urgent.
newTitle: Ajay Kumar Bhalla Appointed Governor of Manipur Amid Ongoing Violence

Structures inside Mehrauli Archaeological Park bear religious significance: ASI tells SC - The Hindu
summary:
Structures inside Mehrauli Archaeological Park bear religious significance: ASI tells SC

Date: December 25, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) has informed the Supreme Court that two significant structures within the Mehrauli Archaeological Park hold religious value, as they are frequented by Muslim devotees.

  • The ASI noted the historical significance of the Ashiq Allah Dargah and Chillagah of Baba Farid, a revered Sufi saint.
  • An inscription reveals the tomb of Shaikh Shahibuddin (Ashiq Allah) was built in 1317 AD.
  • Renovation attempts have affected the site's historical integrity, as reported by ASI.
  • The tomb is located near Prithviraj Chauhan's citadel and is subject to strict regulatory measures.
  • The Supreme Court heard a plea for protection of these structures against potential demolition planned by the Delhi Development Authority.
“Both structures are frequently visited. Devotees light lamps at the Ashiq Dargah for fulfilment of wishes. They visit Chillagah to get rid of evil spirits and bad omen.”

The case highlights the tension between historical preservation and urban development in Delhi.
newTitle: ASI Affirms Religious Importance of Structures in Mehrauli Archaeological Park to Supreme Court
